pull_request_title: Fix missing logging in ErrorHandling Middleware
pull_request_body:
While I remembered to include the error handling for errors raised during rendering, I forgot to include error logging in general. I've replicated the logic present in the ErrorHandler logging code except for the clientIP. This was omitted because it is non-trivial to extract the client IP from a PSR7 request.

Refs #9469

pull_request_title: Fix issues working with large float values.
pull_request_body:
Large float values were being truncated to scientific notation when being passed into PDO. This was caused by PHP's implicit float->string behavior that loses precision. Formatting into %F will retain all the necessary precision.

Refs #9424

pull_request_title: MySQL support for UPDATE/DELETE to use ORDER and LIMIT
pull_request_body:
fixes #9195 

Adds support for more clauses with MySQL for the UPDATE and DELETE queries. Specifically adds support for ORDER and LIMIT.

**TODO**:

[ ] Postgres support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
[ ] Postgres support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
[ ] Postgres support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
[ ] Postgres support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

[ ] SQLite support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
[ ] SQLite support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
[ ] SQLite support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
[ ] SQLite support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

[ ] SQL Server support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
[ ] SQL Server support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
[ ] SQL Server support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
[ ] SQL Server support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

[ ] MySQL support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
[ ] MySQL support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
[ ] MySQL support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
[ ] MySQL support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

pull_request_title: Fix missing base directories in redirect routes.
pull_request_body:
Under the new PSR7 HTTP stack, redirect routes would be missing their base directory as Router did not have the correct context set. Instead of making the Router request stack PSR7 aware, I've made the request context data PSR7 aware by introducing a new public method. Longer term I'd like to remove the request stack entirely, as its requestAction() will also be leaving.

Refs #9470
review_body: @markstory Thanks, It is working well now.\n

pull_request_title: Avoiding extract call in CakeSchema class
pull_request_body: Due bad readability and avoiding parsing error in IDEs - no functional changes. Thank you\n
review_body: Looks good to me.\n

pull_request_title: Allow unescaped URLs to be built. Other helpers need this internally.
pull_request_body:
This is the first step towards https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/9310 and resolving URLs being needed unespaced for further processing.

This PR should start the discussion how to achieve that.
I think this additional param is one option.
It is a rare use case, but easily doable if needed this way.
But I wonder if "full => true" and "escape => false" make any sense.

If this is not BC for extension, we need to target 3.4 instead here, or do in fact need a new method `buildRaw()` or just `raw()` here.
This method could then only have two arguments: $url and $escape.

This works _without_ any external extension or lib, see 

Please see http://php.net/manual/en/function.getimagesize.php

> **Note:** This function does not require the GD image library.

pull_request_title: _lastAction() should also work with named parameters in the url
pull_request_body:
Since version [2.8.8](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/compare/2.8.7...2.8.8#diff-c02fdc21fc32c45375d9c450dc6bf062L3107) `$this->Form->_lastAction()` does not set the `_lastAction` to a correct value, when the url contains named parameters:
- Output of [/users/index/page:1](https://3v4l.org/6ifYr) url
- Output of [/users/index/foo:bar](https://3v4l.org/goqaN) url

The pull request the caused the behavior to change is #9458.

I've added 2 tests that should succeed as far as I'm concerned.

pull_request_title: Drop broken code for fake ajax redirect.
pull_request_body:
As discussed on irc with @hmic. Dropping the feature of fake ajax redirect. 

This breaks my app. ($this->redirect() does not when doing an ajax request)
It is using the deprecated RequestActionTrait. Fixing it is unnecessary base it will be removed soon.

pull_request_title: Drop broken code for fake ajax redirect.
pull_request_body:
As discussed on irc with @hmic. Dropping the feature of fake ajax redirect. 

This breaks my app. ($this->redirect() does not when doing an ajax request)
It is using the deprecated RequestActionTrait. Fixing it is unnecessary base it will be removed soon.

Simple option to preserve keys when using `Collection::chunk`.
Became very useful when fetching results as list:

```
$users = $this->Users->find('list')
    ->chunk(10, true)
    ->toArray();
```

This way the `id => username` association gets reserved.

Simple option to preserve keys when using `Collection::chunk`.
Became very useful when fetching results as list:

```
$users = $this->Users->find('list')
    ->chunk(10, true)
    ->toArray();
```

This way the `id => username` association gets reserved.

This new ResponseEmitter offers some improved ergonomics. It no longer:
- Throws an exception when headers have been sent.
- Truncates content when debug output has been generated in the  controller.

It also uses setcookie() which lets us remove the shims we had to apply to restore behavior of ext/session.

Refs #9472

pull_request_title: Finish implementing withUri() and the PSR7 interface.
pull_request_body:
I missed a parameter and some behavior the first time I implemented withUri(). This shores up that gap and finishes the PSR7 implementation in Network/Request.

Refs #9325
review_body: Looks good to me :)\n

pull_request_title: Allow unescaped URLs to be built. Other helpers need this internally.
pull_request_body:
This is the first step towards https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/9310 and resolving URLs being needed unespaced for further processing.

This PR should start the discussion how to achieve that.
I think this additional param is one option.
It is a rare use case, but easily doable if needed this way.
But I wonder if "full => true" and "escape => false" make any sense.

If this is not BC for extension, we need to target 3.4 instead here, or do in fact need a new method `buildRaw()` or just `raw()` here.
This method could then only have two arguments: $url and $escape.

Add status codes from [Zend/Diactoros](https://github.com/zendframework/zend-diactoros/blob/215f47a73fb2a7f2d33230a3e23658acae234035/src/Response.php#L32-L96) and [httpstatuses.com](https://httpstatuses.com/).

Refers https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/9516#issuecomment-249367130

pull_request_title: Fix requestAction() not working with middleware.
pull_request_body:
The unit tests for requestAction all setup the necessary global state. Which is why they were passing while in reality the code failed. While this feature is deprecated and unloved, it should continue doing the thing it has always done.

Refs #9505
Ref: https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9523\n
Ref: https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9523\n
Ref: https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9523\n

I do still think that adding as inline comments the RFC and Section reference is highly helpful and also will make clear that we support the NON-STANDARD codes 499 and 599.

There are more than 16 RFCs ( https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9528/files#diff-a57bc7407c64664db661cb46c465f363R36 ) and those won't change and its easy to discover what these then mean _by spec_. https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9528/files#diff-a57bc7407c64664db661cb46c465f363R59

The beforeRedirect behavior has surprising behavior and is not something that we'd like to keep around long term. Deprecate the functionality, and provide a config flag for disabling it now.

Refs #9525
Refs #9505

As per cakephp/cakephp#9529.

On SQLServer this seems to be impossible to implement, as [a subquery is neccessary](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/sqlserver/en-US/f09d4166-2030-41fe-b86e-392fbc94db53/tsql-equivalent-for-groupconcat-function?forum=transactsql).

It's currently not possible to pass in a `ExpressionInterface`, to achive something like `GROUP_CONCAT(id+1), but it looks like that's not supported for the other functions either. (And I have no idea how to implement it).

_I don't have tested the generated queries against a real DB server_ I can test against MySQL later, but I don't have access to the other types of servers.

I'm still slightly confused by the Database system, so please tell me if there is a better way to achive this ;)

pull_request_title: Bugfix/cached viewcells return the same results with different templates when rendering
pull_request_body:
See #9531 

The fix was to add the template name to the cache key. However, there is one use-case where the defect is not fixed. If the caller explicitly sets a cache key, then they would always get the same results from `Cell::render()` regardless of the template.

pull_request_title: Use ServerRequest factory to create request instances
pull_request_body:
Now that `Network\Request` implements the PSR7 interface, we can remove the usage of the `RequestTransformer`. I've not removed the transformer in case someone is referencing it in their code.

I've removed the Bad Request error on malformed HTTP versions, instead we ignore the user input and assume they meant `1.1`.

Refs #9325

pull_request_title: Update controllers and components to use PSR7 methods
pull_request_body:
Where possible use the the PSR7 & undeprecated methods in controller & components. I didn't change any of the operations that mutated the request to use the immutable interfaces as there is simply too much shared state in components and controllers right now.

In the future Components will need to stop holding on to references of the request, and instead fetch the request from the controller. This will allow PSR7 methods to be used in more places.

Refs #9325

This PR aims to introduce a `BreadcrumbsHelper` as discussed in #9542.
It exposes an API that allow precise insertions of crumbs (much like the way you'd manage your middlewares) to get around common issues related to the way Cake renders the views.

It also gives an easier way to customize the way the trail is rendered by using the `StringTemplateTrait`, the same way the `FormHelper` does.

The `render()` methods accepts two arguments : 
- the first argument will be used to customize the wrapper of the crumbs trail
- the second argument to customize the separator between crumbs. By default, no separator will be added between each crumbs.

For the templates, I went with what I think are sane default. Feel free to comment on this.

This PR aims to introduce a `BreadcrumbsHelper` as discussed in #9542.
It exposes an API that allow precise insertions of crumbs (much like the way you'd manage your middlewares) to get around common issues related to the way Cake renders the views.

It also gives an easier way to customize the way the trail is rendered by using the `StringTemplateTrait`, the same way the `FormHelper` does.

The `render()` methods accepts two arguments : 
- the first argument will be used to customize the wrapper of the crumbs trail
- the second argument to customize the separator between crumbs. By default, no separator will be added between each crumbs.

For the templates, I went with what I think are sane default. Feel free to comment on this.

Once this is approved, I'll document the docblocks a bit more (to give more details about the arguments of the `render()` methods for instance and how to customize the "innerAttrs") and write something for the book.

pull_request_title: (2.next) Adding Base64 support to the HtmlHelper::image() function
pull_request_body: This allows you to do something like: ``` Html->image('cake.icon.png', ['base64' => true]); ?> ``` and get the following (long) output: ``` ``` I've included a test for this, and it passes the rest of the tests. Considerations: 1) No base64'ing a remote image. Can we rely on [allow-url-fopen](http://php.net/manual/en/filesystem.configuration.php#ini.allow-url-fopen) being enabled? Should I check for the flag and allow you to do it? 2) There's no mime checking, but then again you can currently use image on anything you feel like, so should this code follow convention? 3) How best to handle the case of being unable to file_get_contents? Ideally I'd like to throw, but this would introduce a thrown exception into something that doesn't already throw. If this looks all ok, I'll forward-port this to 3.x (I did it into 2.x first as that's what I know better) Requested by cakephp/cakephp#9560

This PR aims to introduce a `BreadcrumbsHelper` as discussed in #9542.
It exposes an API that allow precise insertions of crumbs (much like the way you'd manage your middlewares) to get around common issues related to the way Cake renders the views.

It also gives an easier way to customize the way the trail is rendered by using the `StringTemplateTrait`, the same way the `FormHelper` does.

The `render()` methods accepts two arguments : 
- the first argument will be used to customize the wrapper of the crumbs trail
- the second argument to customize the separator between crumbs. By default, no separator will be added between each crumbs.

For the templates, I went with what I think are sane default. Feel free to comment on this.

Once this is approved, I'll document the docblocks a bit more (to give more details about the arguments of the `render()` methods for instance and how to customize the "innerAttrs") and write something for the book.

Ideally I'd like to throw, but this would introduce a thrown exception into something that doesn't already throw. If this looks all ok, I'll forward-port this to 3.x (I did it into 2.x first as that's what I know better) Requested by cakephp/cakephp#9560

This PR aims to introduce a `BreadcrumbsHelper` as discussed in #9542.
It exposes an API that allow precise insertions of crumbs (much like the way you'd manage your middlewares) to get around common issues related to the way Cake renders the views.

It also gives an easier way to customize the way the trail is rendered by using the `StringTemplateTrait`, the same way the `FormHelper` does.

The `render()` methods accepts two arguments : 
- the first argument will be used to customize the wrapper of the crumbs trail
- the second argument to customize the separator between crumbs. By default, no separator will be added between each crumbs.

For the templates, I went with what I think are sane default. Feel free to comment on this.

Once this is approved, I'll document the docblocks a bit more (to give more details about the arguments of the `render()` methods for instance and how to customize the "innerAttrs") and write something for the book.

Refs #9542

pull_request_title: (2.next) Adding Base64 support to the HtmlHelper::image() function
pull_request_body: This allows you to do something like: ``` Html->image('cake.icon.png', ['base64' => true]); ?> ``` and get the following (long) output: ``` ``` I've included a test for this, and it passes the rest of the tests. Considerations: 1) No base64'ing a remote image. Can we rely on [allow-url-fopen](http://php.net/manual/en/filesystem.configuration.php#ini.allow-url-fopen) being enabled? Should I check for the flag and allow you to do it? 2) There's no mime checking, but then again you can currently use image on anything you feel like, so should this code follow convention? 3) How best to handle the case of being unable to file_get_contents? Ideally I'd like to throw, but this would introduce a thrown exception into something that doesn't already throw. If this looks all ok, I'll forward-port this to 3.x (I did it into 2.x first as that's what I know better) Requested by cakephp/cakephp#9560

Ref: https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/9211\n

pull_request_title: Update controllers and components to use PSR7 methods
pull_request_body:
Where possible use the the PSR7 & undeprecated methods in controller & components. I didn't change any of the operations that mutated the request to use the immutable interfaces as there is simply too much shared state in components and controllers right now.

In the future Components will need to stop holding on to references of the request, and instead fetch the request from the controller. This will allow PSR7 methods to be used in more places.

Refs #9325

pull_request_title: Use PSR7 request methods in helpers
pull_request_body:
Use undeprecated and PSR7 methods in helpers/view classes. I've also tried to remove the remaining ArrayAccess uses in the tests.

I added in a few `...` operators in the Request class to avoid some `func_get_args()` calls as I know removing those is a minor goal for 3.4.0.

Refs #9325

pull_request_title: (2.next) Adding Base64 support to the HtmlHelper::image() function
pull_request_body: This allows you to do something like: ``` Html->image('cake.icon.png', ['base64' => true]); ?> ``` and get the following (long) output: ``` ``` I've included a test for this, and it passes the rest of the tests. Considerations: 1) No base64'ing a remote image. Can we rely on [allow-url-fopen](http://php.net/manual/en/filesystem.configuration.php#ini.allow-url-fopen) being enabled? Should I check for the flag and allow you to do it? 2) There's no mime checking, but then again you can currently use image on anything you feel like, so should this code follow convention? 3) How best to handle the case of being unable to file_get_contents? Ideally I'd like to throw, but this would introduce a thrown exception into something that doesn't already throw. If this looks all ok, I'll forward-port this to 3.x (I did it into 2.x first as that's what I know better) Requested by cakephp/cakephp#9560

pull_request_title: (2.next) Adding Base64 support to the HtmlHelper::image() function
pull_request_body: This allows you to do something like: ``` Html->image('cake.icon.png', ['base64' => true]); ?> ``` and get the following (long) output: ``` ``` I've included a test for this, and it passes the rest of the tests. Considerations: 1) No base64'ing a remote image. Can we rely on [allow-url-fopen](http://php.net/manual/en/filesystem.configuration.php#ini.allow-url-fopen) being enabled? Should I check for the flag and allow you to do it? 2) There's no mime checking, but then again you can currently use image on anything you feel like, so should this code follow convention? 3) How best to handle the case of being unable to file_get_contents? Ideally I'd like to throw, but this would introduce a thrown exception into something that doesn't already throw. If this looks all ok, I'll forward-port this to 3.x (I did it into 2.x first as that's what I know better) Requested by cakephp/cakephp#9560

This PR aims to introduce a `BreadcrumbsHelper` as discussed in #9542.
It exposes an API that allow precise insertions of crumbs (much like the way you'd manage your middlewares) to get around common issues related to the way Cake renders the views.

It also gives an easier way to customize the way the trail is rendered by using the `StringTemplateTrait`, the same way the `FormHelper` does.

The `render()` methods accepts two arguments : 
- the first argument will be used to customize the wrapper of the crumbs trail
- the second argument to customize the separator between crumbs. By default, no separator will be added between each crumbs.

For the templates, I went with what I think are sane default. Feel free to comment on this.

Once this is approved, I'll document the docblocks a bit more (to give more details about the arguments of the `render()` methods for instance and how to customize the "innerAttrs") and write something for the book.

Refs #9542

pull_request_body:
This is a:
- [x] bug
- [ ] enhancement
- [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)
- CakePHP Version: b03309f
### What you did

Used `_method` in the body of the request to fake a `PATCH` request.
### Expected Behavior

Route is correctly matched.
### Actual Behavior

`Cake\Core\Exception\Exception\MissingRouteException` is thrown.

Add PSR7 `UploadedFileInterface` support to the various `Validation` methods that deal with files. This will help make transitioning to uploaded file objects simpler, as the marshalling/validation process will continue to work as it did with arrays.

This moves the logic in `SelectableAssociationTrait` and `ExternalAssociationTrait` into separate classes that are used as collaborators in the association classes.

I feel this makes the code more readable and easier to grep, as from previous experience, jumping in between the traits was quite a bad experience.

review_body: Looking good.\n

pull_request_body:
Add PSR7 `UploadedFileInterface` support to the various `Validation` methods that deal with files. This will help make transitioning to uploaded file objects simpler, as the marshalling/validation process will continue to work as it did with arrays.

Refs #9325

This moves the logic in `SelectableAssociationTrait` and `ExternalAssociationTrait` into separate classes that are used as collaborators in the association classes.

I feel this makes the code more readable and easier to grep, as from previous experience, jumping in between the traits was quite a bad experience.

This moves the logic in `SelectableAssociationTrait` and `ExternalAssociationTrait` into separate classes that are used as collaborators in the association classes.

I feel this makes the code more readable and easier to grep, as from previous experience, jumping in between the traits was quite a bad experience.

As per cakephp/cakephp#9529.

On SQLServer this seems to be impossible to implement, as [a subquery is neccessary](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/sqlserver/en-US/f09d4166-2030-41fe-b86e-392fbc94db53/tsql-equivalent-for-groupconcat-function?forum=transactsql).

It's currently not possible to pass in a `ExpressionInterface`, to achive something like `GROUP_CONCAT(id+1), but it looks like that's not supported for the other functions either. (And I have no idea how to implement it).

_I don't have tested the generated queries against a real DB server_ I can test against MySQL later, but I don't have access to the other types of servers.

I'm still slightly confused by the Database system, so please tell me if there is a better way to achive this ;)

As per cakephp/cakephp#9529.

On SQLServer this seems to be impossible to implement, as [a subquery is neccessary](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/sqlserver/en-US/f09d4166-2030-41fe-b86e-392fbc94db53/tsql-equivalent-for-groupconcat-function?forum=transactsql).

It's currently not possible to pass in a `ExpressionInterface`, to achive something like `GROUP_CONCAT(id+1), but it looks like that's not supported for the other functions either. (And I have no idea how to implement it).

_I don't have tested the generated queries against a real DB server_ I can test against MySQL later, but I don't have access to the other types of servers.

I'm still slightly confused by the Database system, so please tell me if there is a better way to achive this ;)

pull_request_title: 3.next - Allow image inline in templates and use of mime_content_type in function attachments.
pull_request_body: Use of mime_content_type in function attachments. Allowing image inline in templates: ``` php echo $this->Html->image('cid:///full/path/image'); echo $this->Html->image('file:///full/path/image'); ``` This changes are compatible with CakePHP 2.x and 3.x https://github.com/fawno/FawnoEmail

I noticed in the `InflectorTest` class that the arguments in some of the assertion calls were in the incorrect order.  While this obviously doesn't cause failure, it's not semantically correct, and consistency in programming is usually nice.  This PR fixes the cases that I found.\n

review_body:
Looks useful. I'm not sure automatically munging HTML is going to be safe. But inferring the content-type is a nice addition.

New features require tests before they can be merged in. If you need help with the tests let me know.

pull_request_title: 2.next - Allow image inline in templates and use of mime_content_type in function attachments.

Allowing image inline in templates: ``` php echo $this->Html->image('cid:///full/path/image'); echo $this->Html->image('file:///full/path/image'); ``` This changes are compatible with CakePHP 2.x and 3.x https://github.com/fawno/FawnoEmail

Adds the following to the helper
- moved core of generateUrl() to buildUrl() and returns a raw URL array of pagination parameters.
- generateUrl calls buildUrl()
- added total() which returns page count.
- added to meta() support for generating first and last meta links

The object of the PR is to allow developers to generate pagination URLs in their array format for easier modification outside of the helper.

closes #9503

pull_request_body:
The `fieldList` option for `newEntity` isn't consistent with other parts of the ORM. Where `fields` is used to select what fields will be used (queries as an example).

This PR deprecates `fieldList` and changes it to `fields`. With `fieldList` support working as before and to be removed at a later date.

The `fieldList` option for `newEntity` isn't consistent with other parts of the ORM. Where `fields` is used to select what fields will be used (queries as an example).

This PR deprecates `fieldList` and changes it to `fields`. With `fieldList` support working as before and to be removed at a later date.

The `fieldList` option for `newEntity` isn't consistent with other parts of the ORM. Where `fields` is used to select what fields will be used (queries as an example).

This PR deprecates `fieldList` and changes it to `fields`. With `fieldList` support working as before and to be removed at a later date.

pull_request_title: Debugger: adds configurable masking of array/object properties
pull_request_body:
Adds configurable masking of debugger output by property name and array key names. If you do not want to ever dump passwords, then you can add a global mask like this:

```
Debugger::configInstance('mask', ['password' => '[**********]']);
```

The current defaults are to **not** mask anything. Later, I would like to update the cakephp/app to store a debugger config in `app.php` with some recommended masks (i.e, passwords, social media private keys, etc)

closes #5136 

There was another issue in the debug_kit about passwords being shown in the logs, but I could not find it again. I do not know if this will resolve that issue.

pull_request_title: Use PSR7 response methods where possible.
pull_request_body:
In Component callbacks that return a response we can start using the PSR7 methods as the event dispatcher passes the returned response up the stack and eventually emits it.

Refs #9636

Implements https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/8757

Clean getter/setter API now.
The bad combined ones have been deprecated and can stay in place until 4.x.

The relations are now chainable and autocompletable:

``` php
        $articles->belongsTo('authors')
            ->setForeignKey('author_id')
            ->setName('Authors')
            ->setTarget($authors)
            ->setBindingKey('id')
            ->setConditions([])
            ->setFinder('list')
            ->setProperty('authors')
            ->setJoinType('inner');
```

Small API changes it seems:
- propertyName => setProperty()
- className => setName()

Open questions:
- through option setter/getter for belongsToMany missing? I added one now.

Implement more robust nonce handling in Digest authentication. Shore up some of the implementation gaps we have around nonces. Nonces should expire and should be generated by the server. I've followed the Symfony approach to generating nonces which results in short lived (5 minutes by default) nonces that are regenerated each time the client receives a 401.

By validating and requiring nonce rotation we can avoid replay attacks with our Digest authentication implementation.

I've targetted 3.next as validating/requiring nonce rotation is a behavior change that I feel could trip up application developers. By including it in a minor release we can more effectively communicate the changes.

Refs #9668

Implements https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/8757

Clean getter/setter API now.
The bad combined ones have been deprecated and can stay in place until 4.x.

The relations are now chainable and autocompletable:

``` php
        $articles->belongsTo('authors')
            ->setForeignKey('author_id')
            ->setName('Authors')
            ->setTarget($authors)
            ->setBindingKey('id')
            ->setConditions([])
            ->setFinder('list')
            ->setProperty('authors')
            ->setJoinType('inner');
```

Small API changes it seems:
- propertyName => setProperty()
- className => setName()

- through option setter/getter for belongsToMany missing? I added one now.

pull_request_title: 3.x - Strip aliases from update query conditions where possible.
pull_request_body:
Unlike for delete queries, possible aliases in the conditions of update queries are not being removed, which will fail for some database dialects. Given that update queries currently do not support joins, just like delete queries, removing the aliases here in the same way should be good enough for now I think.

The fact that expressions are being left untouched is something that maybe should go in the docs somewhere, it's something that affects all dependent, non-cascading associated deletes as well, which developers should generally be aware of.

refs #9404

pull_request_title: use array_key_exists() instead of isset() in \Hash::get()
pull_request_body: if `$data['a_key']` exists and it is equal to `null` the `\Hash::get()` returns `false`, it should return `null`\r\n\Hash::get($data,'a_key',false);

pull_request_title: Rename Schema/Table to Schema/TableSchema via class_alias()
pull_request_body:
This PR completes https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9685
The feedback was that Schema should better be TableSchema

Everything is changed expect for a few BC checks in tests and in the subclasses of BaseSchema - to proof that even extension with swapping the alias does not trigger any notices.
review_body: Looks good to me.\n

The `fieldList` option for `newEntity` isn't consistent with other parts of the ORM. Where `fields` is used to select what fields will be used (queries as an example).

This PR deprecates `fieldList` and changes it to `fields`. With `fieldList` support working as before and to be removed at a later date.

pull_request_title: Supprt Unicode escape sequence in Postgresql
pull_request_body:
I,ve fixed my problem on save Unicode JSON in Postgresql with this pull request.

**Error Message:**
```
SQLSTATE[22P05]: Untranslatable character: 7 
ERROR:  unsupported Unicode escape sequence
DETAIL:  Unicode escape values cannot be used for code point values above 007F when the server encoding is not UTF8.
CONTEXT:  JSON data, line 1: {"first_name":...
```

Backporting multiple paginators feature from cakephp 3.3.

Refs #8488

I used **queryScope** instead of **scope** as it is in Cakephp 3, because in Cakephp 2, paginate has a second parameter **$scope** for paginate conditions.

Now that `Cake\Network\Response` implements the PSR7 interfaces we don't need the `ResponseTransformer` any more. This saves us some time and complexity as responses aren't transformed before being emitted.\r\n\r\nRefs #9636

pull_request_title: Split combined into separate getter setter for cleaner API.
pull_request_body:
Start the splitting of combined to separate setter/getter.
Scope is only the important ORM layers:
- Database
- Datasource
- ORM

Key features:
- No more fatal errors or accidents will $null input that triggers the get instead of set call
- Remove method complexity, allow stronger typehinting in the future, better IDE support
- Better speaking API, booleans are more clear from the method name (`autoQuoting()` to `enableAutoQuoting()`/`isEnabledAutoQuoting` etc)
- Chainable setters where it makes sense
- Doc blocks (and therefore API doc) more readable as per their "single responsibility" now
- Methods should never return `$this|otherType`

E.g it removes the confusion around `selectTypeMap()` which does not mean "to select a typeMap" but to "set the typeMap for the select clause" by using `setSelectTypeMap()` and `getSelectTypeMap()`.

Everything is BC, cleanup in 4.0 will be easy, also upgrading will be super easy as people have enough time in 3.x to slowly adjust to the new API.

Methods are still used the old way a lot, to provide BC check and to keep diff readable. Can be done later.

Worth mentioning:

- `Query::bufferResults($enablel)` is now `enableBufferedResults()`/`isEnabledBufferedResults()`.
- `Connection::useSavePoints($enable)` is now `enableSavePoints()`/`isEnabledSavePoints()`.

Better ideas for names welcome. This way it would be consistent, though - and `is...` shows that this is of bool result.

---

Remark for the future:
- We must more declare properties in the tests, just `$this->foo = new Foo()` provides no typehinting etc. This makes the tests and refactoring very difficult. Each `$this->...` assignment must have a property defined IMO.

The `fieldList` option for `newEntity` isn't consistent with other parts of the ORM. Where `fields` is used to select what fields will be used (queries as an example).

This PR deprecates `fieldList` and changes it to `fields`. With `fieldList` support working as before and to be removed at a later date.

E.g it removes the confusion around `selectTypeMap()` which does not mean "to select a typeMap" but to "set the typeMap for the select clause" by using `setSelectTypeMap()` and `getSelectTypeMap()`.

Everything is BC, cleanup in 4.0 will be easy, also upgrading will be super easy as people have enough time in 3.x to slowly adjust to the new API.

Methods are still used the old way a lot, to provide BC check and to keep diff readable. Can be done later.

Worth mentioning:

- `Query::bufferResults($enablel)` is now `enableBufferedResults()`/`isEnabledBufferedResults()`.
- `Connection::useSavePoints($enable)` is now `enableSavePoints()`/`isEnabledSavePoints()`.

Better ideas for names welcome. This way it would be consistent, though - and `is...` shows that this is of bool result.

---

Remark for the future:
- We must more declare properties in the tests, just `$this->foo = new Foo()` provides no typehinting etc. This makes the tests and refactoring very difficult. Each `$this->...` assignment must have a property defined IMO.

pull_request_title: Split combined into separate getter setter for cleaner API.
pull_request_body:
Start the splitting of combined to separate setter/getter.
Scope is only the important ORM layers:
- Database
- Datasource
- ORM

Key features:
- No more fatal errors or accidents will $null input that triggers the get instead of set call
- Remove method complexity, allow stronger typehinting in the future, better IDE support
- Better speaking API, booleans are more clear from the method name (`autoQuoting()` to `enableAutoQuoting()`/`isEnabledAutoQuoting` etc)
- Chainable setters where it makes sense
- Doc blocks (and therefore API doc) more readable as per their "single responsibility" now
- Methods should never return `$this|otherType`

E.g it removes the confusion around `selectTypeMap()` which does not mean "to select a typeMap" but to "set the typeMap for the select clause" by using `setSelectTypeMap()` and `getSelectTypeMap()`.

Everything is BC, cleanup in 4.0 will be easy, also upgrading will be super easy as people have enough time in 3.x to slowly adjust to the new API.

Methods are still used the old way a lot, to provide BC check and to keep diff readable. Can be done later.

Worth mentioning:

- `Query::bufferResults($enablel)` is now `enableBufferedResults()`/`isEnabledBufferedResults()`.
- `Connection::useSavePoints($enable)` is now `enableSavePoints()`/`isEnabledSavePoints()`.

Better ideas for names welcome. This way it would be consistent, though - and `is...` shows that this is of bool result.

---

Remark for the future:
- We must more declare properties in the tests, just `$this->foo = new Foo()` provides no typehinting etc. This makes the tests and refactoring very difficult. Each `$this->...` assignment must have a property defined IMO.

Now that `Cake\Network\Response` implements the PSR7 interfaces we don't need the `ResponseTransformer` any more. This saves us some time and complexity as responses aren't transformed before being emitted.\r\n\r\nRefs #9636

pull_request_title: Allow basic support for MySQL year type
pull_request_body:
Follow up on https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9654

I now confirmed with a real test application that it works together with a custom [YearType](https://github.com/dereuromark/cakephp-shim/blob/master/src/Database/Type/YearType.php).

This patch is required to properly store the values posted on the one side, and to output format it as Year dropdown on the other side for form display.

pull_request_title: MySQL support for UPDATE/DELETE to use ORDER/LIMIT
pull_request_body:
fixes #9195 

Adds support for more clauses with MySQL for the UPDATE and DELETE queries. Specifically adds support for ORDER and LIMIT.

## ORM

- [x] QueryTest verify UPDATE with ORDER/LIMIT works against fixtures on all drivers.
- [x] QueryTest verify DELETE with ORDER/LIMIT works against fixtures on all drivers.

## Postgres

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## SQLite

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## SQL Server

- [ ] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [ ] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [ ] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [ ] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## MySQL

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
  - resolved by QueryCompiler::$_updateParts
- [x] SQL dialect for DELETE
  - resolved by QueryCompiler::$_deleteParts
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

Implement several `get*` methods on `ServerRequest`. These methods are more consistent with the PSR7 methods and each other as they all support dotted paths and default arguments now.

I've left `getData()` able to return all data to help migration/upgrades be easier. `request->data()` is frequently used and I wanted the upgrade path to be a simple search/replace.

Refs #9670

pull_request_title: Make it possible to configure the cacheMethod hashing algorithm in DboSource
pull_request_body:
> Method caching uses `md5` to construct cache keys. If you have problems with collisions, set DboSource::$cacheMethods to false.

Seems like an easy fix for this problem. If you like this feature I can add some tests.

Thanks in advance
By implementing the `engine` method just like in version 3\r\n\r\nFixes #9741

pull_request_title: Make it possible to configure the cacheMethod hashing algorithm in DboSource
pull_request_body:
> Method caching uses `md5` to construct cache keys. If you have problems with collisions, set DboSource::$cacheMethods to false.

Seems like an easy fix for this problem. If you like this feature I can add some tests.

Thanks in advance

pull_request_title: Add debugInfo to Response for better debugging.
pull_request_body:
Doing debug($response) anywhere so far is always quite painful, especially in CLI.
It first outputs the whole internal property stack, including irrelevant long list [protected] _statusCodes as as well as [protected] _mimeTypes

With __debugInfo() it now focuses on the actual data.

pull_request_title: Fix double error tags when option parsing fails.
pull_request_body: When err() started adding formatting for us, we forgot to remove the formatting added when handling option parser errors.\r\n\r\nRefs #9394

pull_request_title: Checking if object before calling method on it
pull_request_body: Prevents "Call to a member function toArray() on a non-object" fatal error when generating an xml with strings containing class-names from your application.

- ORM

Key features:
- No more fatal errors or accidents will $null input that triggers the get instead of set call
- Remove method complexity, allow stronger typehinting in the future, better IDE support
- Better speaking API, booleans are more clear from the method name (`autoQuoting()` to `enableAutoQuoting()`/`isEnabledAutoQuoting` etc)
- Chainable setters where it makes sense
- Doc blocks (and therefore API doc) more readable as per their "single responsibility" now
- Methods should never return `$this|otherType`

E.g it removes the confusion around `selectTypeMap()` which does not mean "to select a typeMap" but to "set the typeMap for the select clause" by using `setSelectTypeMap()` and `getSelectTypeMap()`.

Everything is BC, cleanup in 4.0 will be easy, also upgrading will be super easy as people have enough time in 3.x to slowly adjust to the new API.

Methods are still used the old way a lot, to provide BC check and to keep diff readable. Can be done later.

Worth mentioning:

- `Query::bufferResults($enablel)` is now `enableBufferedResults()`/`isEnabledBufferedResults()`.
- `Connection::useSavePoints($enable)` is now `enableSavePoints()`/`isEnabledSavePoints()`.

Better ideas for names welcome. This way it would be consistent, though - and `is...` shows that this is of bool result.

---

Remark for the future:
- We must more declare properties in the tests, just `$this->foo = new Foo()` provides no typehinting etc. This makes the tests and refactoring very difficult. Each `$this->...` assignment must have a property defined IMO.

pull_request_title: False positives and conflicts list for shells
pull_request_body:
As discussed in #9728 this will fix shell naming conflicts between plugins:

- [x] Avoid reporting that shall name of PluginName conflicts with PluginName
- [x] List all plugins that conflicts for a specific shall command

pull_request_body:
fixes #9195 

Adds support for more clauses with MySQL for the UPDATE and DELETE queries. Specifically adds support for ORDER and LIMIT.

## ORM

- [x] QueryTest verify UPDATE with ORDER/LIMIT works against fixtures on all drivers.
- [x] QueryTest verify DELETE with ORDER/LIMIT works against fixtures on all drivers.

## Postgres

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## SQLite

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## SQL Server

- [ ] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [ ] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [ ] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [ ] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## MySQL

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
  - resolved by QueryCompiler::$_updateParts
- [x] SQL dialect for DELETE
  - resolved by QueryCompiler::$_deleteParts
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

pull_request_title: Allow basic support for MySQL year type
pull_request_body:
Follow up on https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9654

I now confirmed with a real test application that it works together with a custom [YearType](https://github.com/dereuromark/cakephp-shim/blob/master/src/Database/Type/YearType.php).

This patch is required to properly store the values posted on the one side, and to output format it as Year dropdown on the other side for form display.

pull_request_title: Split Config trait modals into getter and setter.
pull_request_body:
Completes further the goal of the clean API.

The mix of string+array vs array mix alone is really bongers, and the code so far was rather complex to understand the many use cases.

I wonder if we could split the two cases above further?
- setConfig ($key, $value)
- setConfigFromArray(array $configArray)

What do you think?

pull_request_title: fixes greedy dots in extension parsing
pull_request_body:
closes #9765 

- removes the usage of regex in parsing extensions, and uses a simple "string ends with" check for extensions.
- updates `extensions()` with `setExtensions()` and `getExtensions()`
- added unit tests for changes
- adds stub class to expose protected methods (unit test only)

pull_request_title: 3.next - Start adding Response helpers and fix some issues.
pull_request_body:
Add `withLocation()` and `withType()`. These are immutable versions of `type()` and `location()`. Unfortunately this spiraled a bit out of control as I wanted to keep the tests passing. However, I've:

* Fixed getHeaders() not always following PSR7 interface requirements  when headers are set with `header()`.
* Restored behavior where the status code is set to 302 when a location  header is set and the current status is 200.
* Eagerly set the 'Content-Type' header so that charset(), type() and  withType() all result in the content-type header being correctly set.   This also fixes an issue where the content type would not be correctly  set when the response was emitted.

Refs #9636

pull_request_title: Reduce use of duplicate code for transactions
pull_request_body:
closes #9773 

- adds a simple `_executeTransaction` for either transaction or none on a callback
- adds a simple `_getCommitUsed` which returns `true` if there was a transaction committed.

This ended up being a smaller/simpler change then I originally thought it was going to be.

Which is a good thing 😄

pull_request_title: Reduce use of duplicate code for transactions
pull_request_body:
closes #9773 

- adds a simple `_executeTransaction` for either transaction or none on a callback
- adds a simple `_getCommitUsed` which returns `true` if there was a transaction committed.

This ended up being a smaller/simpler change then I originally thought it was going to be.

Which is a good thing 😄

pull_request_title: 3.next - Start adding Response helpers and fix some issues.
pull_request_body:
Add `withLocation()` and `withType()`. These are immutable versions of `type()` and `location()`. Unfortunately this spiraled a bit out of control as I wanted to keep the tests passing. However, I've:

* Fixed getHeaders() not always following PSR7 interface requirements  when headers are set with `header()`.
* Restored behavior where the status code is set to 302 when a location  header is set and the current status is 200.
* Eagerly set the 'Content-Type' header so that charset(), type() and  withType() all result in the content-type header being correctly set.   This also fixes an issue where the content type would not be correctly  set when the response was emitted.

Refs #9636

pull_request_title: fixes greedy dots in extension parsing
pull_request_body:
closes #9765 

- removes the usage of regex in parsing extensions, and uses a simple "string ends with" check for extensions.
- updates `extensions()` with `setExtensions()` and `getExtensions()`
- added unit tests for changes
- adds stub class to expose protected methods (unit test only)

pull_request_title: Updates the ConnectionInterface with missing methods.
pull_request_body: Many spots in the ORM reference the `ConnectionInterface` interface but proceed to call `Connection` object methods directly. These method calls are flagged as interface does not support method by PhpStorm.\r\n\r\nThis PR adds popular methods to the interface that all `Connection` objects need to implement since the core assumes the object has them.

pull_request_title: MySQL support for UPDATE/DELETE to use ORDER/LIMIT
pull_request_body:
fixes #9195 

Adds support for more clauses with MySQL for the UPDATE and DELETE queries. Specifically adds support for ORDER and LIMIT.

## ORM

- [x] QueryTest verify UPDATE with ORDER/LIMIT works against fixtures on all drivers.
- [x] QueryTest verify DELETE with ORDER/LIMIT works against fixtures on all drivers.

## Postgres

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## SQLite

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## SQL Server

- [ ] SQL dialect for UPDATE
- [ ] SQL dialect for DELETE
- [ ] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [ ] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [ ] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

## MySQL

- [x] SQL dialect for UPDATE
  - resolved by QueryCompiler::$_updateParts
- [x] SQL dialect for DELETE
  - resolved by QueryCompiler::$_deleteParts
- [x] Support for ORDER in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in UPDATE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for ORDER in DELETE with unit tests.
- [x] Support for LIMIT in DELETE with unit tests.

pull_request_title: Split Config trait modals into getter and setter.
pull_request_body:
Completes further the goal of the clean API.

The mix of string+array vs array mix alone is really bongers, and the code so far was rather complex to understand the many use cases.

I wonder if we could split the two cases above further?
- setConfig ($key, $value)
- setConfigFromArray(array $configArray)

What do you think?

It should forward the settings from ClassRegistry::init() so that aliases can be customized as needed.\r\n\r\nRefs #9766

pull_request_title: Fix clearing content-type when status is 204/304
pull_request_body:
Responses with these status codes do not have response bodies, by clearing the content-type header we can make responses more consistent with how CakePHP has historically performed.

Refs #9636

pull_request_title: Fix clearing content-type when status is 204/304
pull_request_body:
Responses with these status codes do not have response bodies, by clearing the content-type header we can make responses more consistent with how CakePHP has historically performed.

Refs #9636

This resolves issue #7324 as described in my comment there.

You can define the sort order of pagination in pagination settings array.  
These settings are unioned with the request query parameters, request query always comes first.  

Due to the union, if the sort field of the request query is already defined by the settings array, the settings array will not overwrite the request query sort field.  

If no request query sort field is set (e.g. initial page 1), the pagination URL is created with the first settings entry, which has the same effect than ommiting it in the URL.

If no request query sort field is set (e.g. initial page 1), the pagination URL is created with the first settings entry, which has the same effect than ommiting it in the URL.

pull_request_title: BreadcrumbsHelper::render() returns null with no crumbs
pull_request_body:
See https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/9798\r\n\r\nThe `render()` method should return `null` (or a blank string) if empty (now it returns the string `
    `), in other words if you have not added any crumb.

pull_request_title: Move default into class so simpler ::class syntax can be used.
pull_request_body:
The default should be moved inside the class to allow simpler Application setup:
```php
		$middleware
			->add(MaintenanceMiddleware::class)
			->add(ErrorHandlerMiddleware::class)
			->add(AssetMiddleware::class)
			->add(RoutingMiddleware::class);
```
etc

No need to force instantiation here.

pull_request_title: Allow loading and unloading plugins for bootstrap_cli
pull_request_body:
Implements https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/9150

      bin/cake plugin load Foo --cli

Note that the regexp in unload task has to be fixed because / as delimiter won't work with plugin load calls like
    
     Plugin::load('ADmad/HybridAuth', ['routes' => true]);

I found that out when testing it.

It's a bad idea to write tests that delete files in the TMP:

This resolves issue #7324 as described in my comment there.

You can define the sort order of pagination in pagination settings array.  
These settings are unioned with the request query parameters, request query always comes first.  

Due to the union, if the sort field of the request query is already defined by the settings array, the settings array will not overwrite the request query sort field.  

If no request query sort field is set (e.g. initial page 1), the pagination URL is created with the first settings entry, which has the same effect than ommiting it in the URL.

* withEtag
* withNotModified
* withSharable
* withMaxAge

pull_request_title: Flash messages stack and in cases can result in duplicate messages
pull_request_body:
Hi, 
I didn't make an issue for this as it seemed too simple. 

Stacking of Flash messages is a really nice feature, but when doing the following:
client_posts_data -> appcontroller_sets_flash -> a_controller_receives_post_and_redirects -> 
appcontroller_sets_flash =
view rendered with duplicate flash messages. 

I added a configuration key "duplicate", when set to false, skips adding messages that are already in the stack.

This resolves issue #7324 as described in my comment there.

You can define the sort order of pagination in pagination settings array.  
These settings are unioned with the request query parameters, request query always comes first.  

Due to the union, if the sort field of the request query is already defined by the settings array, the settings array will not overwrite the request query sort field.  

If no request query sort field is set (e.g. initial page 1), the pagination URL is created with the first settings entry, which has the same effect than ommiting it in the URL.

pull_request_title: Move default into class so simpler ::class syntax can be used.
pull_request_body:
The default should be moved inside the class to allow simpler Application setup:
```php
		$middleware
			->add(MaintenanceMiddleware::class)
			->add(ErrorHandlerMiddleware::class)
			->add(AssetMiddleware::class)
			->add(RoutingMiddleware::class);
```
etc

No need to force instantiation here.

pull_request_title: Add support for select multiple=checkbox required=required
pull_request_body:
As far as I can tell, this commit `aa60b8791a213acc1a3ffbc5c6d41e5c12e74727` removed at least some support of the required attribute on multiple=checkbox. I am trying to use input type="select" multiple="checkbox" required="required"

My change places the required attribute in place only for that scenario, because for instance I know doing it for all cases in _selectOptions caused tests to fail on, for example:

```
<select>
<option required="required"></option>
<option required="required"></option>
</select>
```

Please let me know if I'm off base here, or why support for that attribute should not be added. Also let me know if I need to change my base, I wasn't sure which was the best place to base 2.x changes from.

pull_request_title: Allow basic support for MySQL year type
pull_request_body:
Follow up on https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9654

I now confirmed with a real test application that it works together with a custom [YearType](https://github.com/dereuromark/cakephp-shim/blob/master/src/Database/Type/YearType.php).

This patch is required to properly store the values posted on the one side, and to output format it as Year dropdown on the other side for form display.

pull_request_title: Make use of built-in message template of MissingElementException
pull_request_body:
Reverts #9854 as it copy & pasted the built-in message only.

Makes use of:
https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/3.3.10/src/View/Exception/MissingElementException.php#L28

Improved tests to prevent that, too.

Fix missing HTML encoding when error messages contain HTML. This can happen when user data is used as an offset in an array in an unchecked way.\r\n\r\nThanks to Teppei Fukuda for reporting this issue via the responsible security disclosure process.

pull_request_title: Dont use magic numbers for success code either.
pull_request_body:
A while back I fixed the error code, but I forgot to also include the success code.
This rectifies it for clarity.

One should never use the magic numbers here directly as from looking at it they are exactly the opposite of what you would intuitively expect (and their boolean representation).

Resolves also some of the initial confusion that lead to
https://github.com/cakephp/docs/pull/4532

pull_request_title: Clean up Email API and combined setter getter methods.
pull_request_body:
The Email class was a huge mess so far.

The following methods did not return $this for reading:
* charset()
* headerCharset()

That can be dangerous when using in chaining, as all other methods do chain as expected, and those would suddenly break it.

Also
* emailPattern() had to set false to read, null would reset.
* readReceipt() sounds like it reads, but in fact is a setter in not null argument case...
* template($template = false, $layout = false) has a weird double set/get of mixed template and layout, separation needed
* viewRender() should be viewRenderer() or viewBuilder()

So this all cleans this up, makes it future proof, and that while retaining BC.

Additionally (in a separate commit after all tests verified BC):
* Deprecated viewBuilder methods have also been replaced with the correct ones.
* Deprecated Mailer and Email class method usage has been replace with the correct ones.

PS: We can apply the self to $this doc block changes after this has been merged to avoid conflicts.

PS: We can apply the self to $this doc block changes after this has been merged to avoid conflicts.
review_body: What is the plan for adding tests for all these new methods? Right now they are getting covered by the existing combined methods. Is splitting the tests up something you think we should tackle later on?

The following methods did not return $this for reading:

That can be dangerous when using in chaining, as all other methods do chain as expected, and those would suddenly break it.

So this all cleans this up, makes it future proof, and that while retaining BC.

Additionally (in a separate commit after all tests verified BC):

Continuing the work from #9898. This is PR to integrate [PHPStan](https://github.com/phpstan/phpstan) into the CI build of CakePHP.

It's a work in progress since there are quite a lot of errors in the build log. `@property` annotations are already supported by PHPStan, but it still found some undefined properties.

Even after merging this PR, I expect to continue to work with you on increasing the level of strictness of the analysis and also on updating to newer versions of PHPStan :)

I'd like one of the maintainers to go through the error log and fix obvious errors in the code. We can then work together on the other, more questionable, errors.

I'd like one of the maintainers to go through the error log and fix obvious errors in the code. We can then work together on the other, more questionable, errors.

pull_request_title: Add support for multiple values option in the Shell system
pull_request_body:
This PR improves the shell parser by adding the ability to have options that accepts multiple values, with a new `multiple` (a boolean) parameter e.g. :

```php
$parser->addOption('source', ['short' => 's', 'multiple' => true]);
```

When calling a shell :

```
bin/cake some_shell -n report -s mysql -s postgres
```

When you call that, the option will be rendered as an array, even if you only have one element.

I went with `multiple` but I am opened to suggestions on the name of the option. I considered `array` at first but it was not clear enough in my opinion.

pull_request_title: RFC - Allow routes to restrict the hosts they should match on
pull_request_body:
By passing the request we can make it possible to add route conditions for more than just the URL. I've had to add new methods onto Router and RouteCollection to make this possible, but I feel that passing the object around is better long term anyways.

This requires deprecating `Router::parse()` which makes me a bit sad, but I feel this makes the code simpler/better long term.

This is currently an RFC as I want to see if people think the addition of the `_host` option is worth the churn in code. Also if there are any other similar types of conditions/matchers we should add.

Refs #9917

pull_request_title: Fix wrong dimensions when the first element is false.
pull_request_body:
`Hash::maxDimensions` returns wrong value when the first element is false.
```php
$data = [
   '1' => false,
   '2' => ['2.1' => '2.1.1']
];
$result = Hash::maxDimensions($data); // $result is 0.
```
Because `reset` returns false when empty array or the first element is false.

pull_request_title: Update thrown message to indicate missing method/route combination, addressing #9994.
pull_request_body: The message of the `MissingRouteException` thrown when a route cannot be found now includes the method used to (attempt to) access the route, as well as the path of the route. This addresses a problem where the user (developer) could be presented with a message such as "A route matching 'x' could not be found. List of available routes: 'x'". It is now made explicit that e.g. "A 'POST' route matching 'x' could not be found."

pull_request_title: Fix context/plural related issues in i18n
pull_request_body:
Because we were using the stock translator from Aura, we had painful issues when:

* A plural message was used with `__()` an array would be returned which
  is never right.
* When an unknown context is used the `__x()` method fails.

I don't think the change in the translator type matters. If it bothers someone, I can move this to 3.4.0

Refs #8833
Refs #9985

I don't think the change in the translator type matters. If it bothers someone, I can move this to 3.4.0

Refs #8833
Refs #9985

pull_request_title: Fix context/plural related issues in i18n
pull_request_body:
Because we were using the stock translator from Aura, we had painful issues when:

* A plural message was used with `__()` an array would be returned which
  is never right.
* When an unknown context is used the `__x()` method fails.

I don't think the change in the translator type matters. If it bothers someone, I can move this to 3.4.0

Refs #8833
Refs #9985

pull_request_title: Merge in defaults from subcommand for the parser description.
pull_request_body:
### Before
```php
        $parser->addSubcommand('infos', [
            'help' => 'Get some GitHub infos',
            'parser' => [
                //'description' => 'Get some GitHub infos' // Without declaring this again
            ],
        ]);
```

results in no --help output (displaying main page again) and
```
Usage:
cake release [subcommand] [-d] [-h] [-q] [-v]

Subcommands:

infos  Get some GitHub infos
pr     Release PR

To see help on a subcommand use `cake release [subcommand] --help`
```

It only works if you manually copy and paste the help text into the parser description (unDRY).

### After
The above results in expected

```
Get some GitHub infos

Usage:
cake release infos [-h] [-q] [-v]

Options:

--help, -h     Display this help.
--quiet, -q    Enable quiet output.
--verbose, -v  Enable verbose output.
```

pull_request_title: Make Collection::every() return true for empty sets.
pull_request_body:
An empty list should pass all conditions as it is the vacuous truth. We incorrectly made Collection::every() return false in #8670. Returning true makes Collection::every() match implementations in most other languages/libraries.

Add additional tests to other filter/member checks to verify empty set behavior there as well.

Refs #10002

pull_request_title: Split Config trait modals into getter and setter.
pull_request_body:
Completes further the goal of the clean API.

The mix of string+array vs array mix alone is really bongers, and the code so far was rather complex to understand the many use cases.

I wonder if we could split the two cases above further?
- setConfig ($key, $value)
- setConfigFromArray(array $configArray)

What do you think?

I added contants representing the debug mode of CakePHP.

1. This way it will be more easily to find with your IDE where you are doing something like this

```
if (Configure::read('debug') > CAKE_DEEP_DEBUG_MODE) {

}
```

2. Makes it more verbose than having to know what 0,1,2 does all the time.

pull_request_title: Shift subcommand propagation to be at help generation.

pull_request_title: Use absolute autoloader path for better test tools integration.
pull_request_body:
Using ab absolute path helps with tools that run in environments
where the current working directory does not point to the root of the
project.

For example in my IDE I can do "**Right click > Run test**" in a test method body, on the test class, or even on a folder, in order to run single test methods, single test classes, or specific folders only. However, the CWD will point to the selected folder, respectively the folder that contains the test class file, so including the autoloader will fail.

pull_request_body:
Add type checking to update method. This prevents setting `$this->_parts['update'][0]` with a value which can't be processed by _buildUpdatePart and causes an "Array to string conversion" error on [this line](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/master/src/Database/QueryCompiler.php#L343)

This is possibly related to #9735 

Thanks

review_body:
```
UPDATE Table1 t1, Table2 t2 SET 
t2.field = t2.field+2,
t1.field = t1.field+2

WHERE t1.id = t2.foreign_id and t2.id = '123414'
```

MS-SQL supports multiple tables in an update statement, and I do believe there are some people doing this in the wild.

pull_request_title: Static method to create Mailer instances
pull_request_body:
I've moved the code that creates a new ```Mailer``` instance in the ```MailerAwareTrait``` to a static method. The trait keeps working the same.

I think it's painful having to import the trait every time I need a ```Mailer``` instance in a different class.

Fixes #10071.

pull_request_title: Link HasMany associations using a single transaction
pull_request_body:
HasMany->link is now using a single database transaction instead of multiple transactions.
BelongsToMany->link already was using a single transaction.

HasMany->unlink uses the updateAll function therefore I do not believe any changes are required.

Ref: #8196

During our PHP 7 upgrade I encountered this incorrect `@return` comment.\r\n\r\nFound using [etsy/phan](https://github.com/etsy/phan) ([see](https://github.com/cloudflare/docker-phan#getting-docker-phan)). There are probably more in `lib`, but I only scanned `app` (for now).

During our PHP 7 upgrade I encountered this incorrect `@return` comment.\r\n\r\nFound using [etsy/phan](https://github.com/etsy/phan) ([see](https://github.com/cloudflare/docker-phan#getting-docker-phan)). There are probably more in `lib`, but I only scanned `app` (for now).

I was learning how the ORM in CakePHP works and found the ValueBinder class that had some behaviour I believe to be incorrect (please correct me if i'm wrong).

$valueBinder->placeholder describes itself as taking a token and returning a SQL param based based on that token. The PHPDOC block also mentions that '?' should return '?' and ':value' should return ':value'.

What happened 
-----------------
$valueBinder->placeholder('param');
> ':c0'

$valueBinder->placeholder('?')
> ':c1'

$valueBinder->placeholder(':param')
> ':c2'

What I expected to happen:
----------------------------
$valueBinder->placeholder('param')
> ':param0'

$valueBinder->placeholder('?')
> '?'

$valueBinder->placeholder(':param')
> ':param'

After further investigation I found that around ~33 tests were written assuming this bug so I updated those tests.

I found some small code improvements (removing unused variables, reduce logic duplication, etc) 

I also created unit tests for the class in question.

I will comment the main change to logic using github code review tools.

$valueBinder->placeholder describes itself as taking a token and returning a SQL param based based on that token. The PHPDOC block also mentions that '?' should return '?' and ':value' should return ':value'.

pull_request_title: Show the CakePHP logo on the top of the README

Showing a logo on the top of a readme gives the else boring looking page a little coloured touch.
As we don't have to hide our awesome logo, I added it to the README :)

Before:

pull_request_body: As discussed in #10158 and #9653.

With the release of phpunit version 6.0 it is not possible for us to test
the framework with versions older than PHP 7.

There are clever ways of solving this problem, but I think there are no interesting
features in verion 6 that we require for the time being.

Following [comments](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/10142).

Association names are mutable, but that change isn't reflected in a collection nor the target table. Changing association name without manually reattaching it in a collection makes it unusable. `EagerLoader` [checks if these names match](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/3.next/src/ORM/EagerLoader.php#L496) and throws an exception. Is this exception enough or should we disallow changing association name as it would probably break it?

In other words `AssociationCollection` key, `Association` name and target `Table` alias should be identical. Changing one of them would probably break things.

My way to improve this is to check if a new association name matches the target table alias **after** it has been resolved.

There's also an issue with `AssociationCollection` not reflecting association name change, but I'm not sure we can do anything about it without changing the way associations are collected.
review_body: Looks ok to me, but needs some tests.

Also, I fixed `BelongsToMany::targetForeignKey()` returns `$this`.

Related to https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/pull/9676

pull_request_title: QueryLogger strips some characters from queries
pull_request_body:
When using DebugKit SqlLog, I noticed that when saving hashed user password, log contained
`UPDATE users SET password = 'y$uEFBAE...' WHERE id = 123` which is not in valid Bcrypt format.

But after checking database, password was saved correctly as `'$2a$10$uEFBAE...'`.

I enabled logging to text file - still same result, so not fault of DebugKit.

After inspecting code, problem is that QueryLogger interpolates bind parameters using `preg_replace`: but `preg_replace` replacement string uses `$1` or `\1` for backreferences.

`$2` and `$10` in hash refers to invalid backrefences, so replaced with empty strings.

Another possible common string could be "$0.12" which would replace to `":p1.12"` because `$0` refers to bind parameter matched by the whole pattern.

---

My commit escapes `$` and `\` to `\$` and `\` to ignore them by preg_replace.

Also I replace `'` to double single-quote `''` and `\` to `\`  to be even more valid SQL string. This is why there is `\` to `\\` replacement (preg_replace and SQL escape).

Also I replace `'` to double single-quote `''` and `\` to `\`  to be even more valid SQL string. This is why there is `\` to `\\` replacement (preg_replace and SQL escape).

pull_request_title: QueryLogger strips some characters from queries
pull_request_body:
When using DebugKit SqlLog, I noticed that when saving hashed user password, log contained
`UPDATE users SET password = 'y$uEFBAE...' WHERE id = 123` which is not in valid Bcrypt format.

But after checking database, password was saved correctly as `'$2a$10$uEFBAE...'`.

I enabled logging to text file - still same result, so not fault of DebugKit.

After inspecting code, problem is that QueryLogger interpolates bind parameters using `preg_replace`: but `preg_replace` replacement string uses `$1` or `\1` for backreferences.

`$2` and `$10` in hash refers to invalid backrefences, so replaced with empty strings.

Another possible common string could be "$0.12" which would replace to `":p1.12"` because `$0` refers to bind parameter matched by the whole pattern.

---

My commit escapes `$` and `\` to `\$` and `\` to ignore them by preg_replace.

Also I replace `'` to double single-quote `''` and `\` to `\`  to be even more valid SQL string. This is why there is `\` to `\\` replacement (preg_replace and SQL escape).
Optional is_uploaded_file() validation.
Optional is_uploaded_file() validation.

pull_request_title: Fix up config() to accept any scalar value for getting as per setConfig()
pull_request_body:
I have the following log config on app.php:
```php
	'Log' => [
		'debug' => [
			'scopes' => false,
			'className' => 'DatabaseLog.Database'
		],
		'error' => [
			'scopes' => false,
			'className' => 'DatabaseLog.Database'
		],
		'404' => [
			'className' => 'DatabaseLog.Database',
			'type' => '404',
			'levels' => ['error'],
			'scopes' => ['404'],
		]
```
Those are all strings.
Somewhere inside the core, though, some type joggling makes this a integer 404 then as key, breaking the config() nonsplit method.
Using this fix it works again as expected (as it checks for the actual array vs non array), and this is the same check used inside setConfig(), so it is then consistent, as well.

Note: it used to work in 3.3 and before like this, that's why this is a regression bugfix.
review_body: Any tests we could add?

pull_request_body: I removed PHPStan from `allow_failures` because I think it should pass now. Let's see if the build passes :)

pull_request_title: Fix up config() to accept any scalar value for getting as per setConfig()
pull_request_body:
I have the following log config on app.php:
```php
	'Log' => [
		'debug' => [
			'scopes' => false,
			'className' => 'DatabaseLog.Database'
		],
		'error' => [
			'scopes' => false,
			'className' => 'DatabaseLog.Database'
		],
		'404' => [
			'className' => 'DatabaseLog.Database',
			'type' => '404',
			'levels' => ['error'],
			'scopes' => ['404'],
		]
```
Those are all strings.
Somewhere inside the core, though, some type joggling makes this a integer 404 then as key, breaking the config() nonsplit method.
Using this fix it works again as expected (as it checks for the actual array vs non array), and this is the same check used inside setConfig(), so it is then consistent, as well.

Note: it used to work in 3.3 and before like this, that's why this is a regression bugfix.
I removed PHPStan from `allow_failures` because I think it should pass now. Let's see if the build passes :)

pull_request_title: New cookie implementation for the HTTP stack
pull_request_body:
## New prototype implementation for cookies

It needs more tests and I'm not yet happy with the handling of the cookie data and encryption. But I would already like to get feedback on this to continue to develop it into a direction we all agree with.

The code is partially based on https://github.com/hansott/psr7-cookies/ but was changed to fit into our current API and the frameworks current php version. I've had a discussion with Mark Story if we'll directly use it or not. The final decision for the named reasons was to come up with our own implementation. I've also changed the implementation in some aspects, it's not a copy and paste job. I need some advice if we need to give credits and copyright and if yes, how to do it the right way.

Cookies can now be used from wherever the request object and response objects are available.

## Overview of the new implementation

* Uses the request and response objects
* Uses a cookie object to built and modify a cookie
* Generates cookie objects from the request object
* Writes cookies to the response object
* Uses getters and setters
* No longer a component bound controller layer only solution (This change is required to get the cookie authenticator in the new authentication implementation working)
* **TBD**: If possible a BC compatible cookie component that uses the new implementation

## Related issues

* https://github.com/cakephp/authentication/issues/26
